decks.notes: The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes cards that boost the power of creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Heartfire Hero, as well as direct damage spells like Monstrous Rage and Titan's Strength. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck by allowing the player to have access to an additional mana source. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats while utilizing burn spells to finish them off.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering or removing opponent's threats while generating card advantage through draw spells and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional value in the form of a free creature that can pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes powerful lands like Castle Ardenvale and Field of Ruin to provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Spirit tribe to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan with counter and removal spells. The key strategy is to control the board with efficient Spirit creatures like Spell Queller and Skyclave Apparition, while also utilizing powerful spells like No More Lies and Wedding Announcement to further support the aggressive playstyle. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of evasive threats and disruptive elements to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Greasefang Parhelion combo to generate value and overwhelm opponents. The deck includes cards like Parhelion II, Greasefang, and Say Its Name to create powerful synergies and generate advantage. By combining creatures such as Esika's Chariot and Overlord of the Balemurk with support cards like Thoughtseize and Bitter Triumph, the deck aims to control the battlefield while setting up its combo pieces for a devastating finish. Using cards like Raffine's Informant and Altanak, the Thrice-Called, the deck can ensure consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Opt and Consider, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with Thoughtseize and Sheoldred's Edict. By utilizing cheap spells and mana-efficient threats like Arclight Phoenix and Picklock Prankster, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent's life total early on. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Ledger Shredder allows for additional late-game reach, while Treasure Cruise helps to refuel the hand and keep the pressure on. Ultimately, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.
